1.content:
The afternoon fall sun shone on a lone figure hanging from a tree. A shortish young woman, no older than eighteen, hanging from a noose. Her pale, blue-gray eyes were staring down as the small curls of her shaggy blond hair hung out from under her beanie and into her face.

"...Someone gonna let me down?" She asked as she looked around.

Lucile, a frightfully out there young woman, was rather bored with her life. She was always very strange in how she questioned everything in her life, to the point of annoyance for anyone else. She always had a rather...strange view on how to live her life. When some girls came over to her house to try and bully her a good two years back, they found her standing by the wood chipper with red, pulpy gunk flying out. Those girls never bothered her again, leaving Lucile to laugh as she tossed another watermelon inside the chipper.

She lived alone, what became of her parents no one knows. Each time she answered it was a different story, her father vanished into the ether during a trip to Las Vegas, her mother died playing Russian Roulette because she thought she won, but the safety had been turned on, they both moved to Canada to escape the IRS...always something strange.

Lucile struggled, kicking her legs as wind blew through the rips in her black jeans while gripping the head of the noose.

She wanted to see what it would be like to try and kill herself, what it would feel like to people who didn't want to live anymore.

The branch above broke, and the skinny young woman fell, hitting her back on a cluster of tree branches, groaning as she lay on the ground.

Suicide was far too painful for her taste.

Laying on the ground pitifully for about two and a half minutes before she brought herself up to her legs, clutching her back with one hand as she readjusted herself.

"Maybe not my best choice to pass time." She groaned as she reached for a Hershey bar she kept in her front pants pocket that, thankfully, had not broken or crumbled on impact.

She took a bite, looking up into the early afternoon sky with her bored, dull blue eyes.

"Well I don't have time to kill myself, but I have time to kill" She said to herself with a straight face, taking another bite of her candy bar.

"Could always just go for a walk, see what happens." She said to herself aloud with a mouth full of chocolate. "Not like anything weird's gonna happen to me or anything really eventful in my book."

She carelessly tossed part of the ripped-off wrapper aside as she walked passed a taxi that had crashed into a 1970's Lincoln.

Sometimes Lucile stuck to the roads and sidewalks when she walked, but more often she played the As The Crow Flies game and just set out in a straight line. It was interesting to see how far you could get without deviating from the path. Sometimes you had to climb over things or walk across somebody's yard or through somebody's house, but she didn't see why such people as urban planners and homeowners should get to make all the decisions about how somebody else's walk should go.

So she started off on the sidewalk, but when it curved, she kept going. She walked into the woods and down a hill and splashed through a stream and climbed up a muddy embankment and fought her way through some blackberry bushes.

She was starting to look like a hobo had mated with a leaf collection.

She stuffed the rest of the chocolate bar in her mouth and smacked loudly. It was pretty good. Somehow, things tasted better when you'd very nearly died. She decided to buy some more at the first opportunity. She had to walk for nearly two miles before her arrow-straight path carried her into a 7-up and past a rack of candy bars, where she picked up a box of Hershey's. Unfortunately the straight line went nowhere near the cash register. Instead, she was forced to shoplift the candy bars and wriggle out through the bathroom window. It's not that she was a thief, but the As The Crow Flies game was a matter of principal.

Lucile plopped down on the first park bench that crossed her path and unwrapped a candy bar. It was delicious. She wondered if she could eat the entire box in a sitting. Now, that would be a new experience. It was a hell of a lot of chocolate, though, she thought. By the end of this, I'll either be puking up mudslides, or I'll hold it all down and just get fat as hell. She wondered which it would be.

It wasn't like a little extra weight would hurt her. If she'd been just a little lighter, after all, she'd be twisting lifelessly in the wind like an underweight ham right now. When you thought about it, packing on a few pounds was a vital safety precaution.

She felt exhilarated, and wasn't sure if it was the new lease on life or all the sugar, or a little of both.

Of course, she had to rest it on a pillow, because her stomach was so totally flat, not like what that crazy liar Lucile had said at all. It wasn't fair to call her fat just because she called them like she saw them. She'd taken up the Thin Girl's Burden. After all, if you didn't tell fat people they were fat, they might forget, and that would be bad for their health. When you thought about it, she wasn't just trolling Facebook looking for chubby cosplayers who she could inform of such little-known afflictions as diabetes and heart attacks. She was saving lives. She was a goddamn hero.

The doorbell rang. Ashlin skipped over and swept the door open it. "Who iiiiiiis it?" she sang. Followed by "Guhh". She didn't sing "guhh". She just guhhed.

"Hi", said the boy on the doorstep. "I'm internationally famous tween sensation Dustin Castor, multi-platinum selling artist and originator of the musical genres of bubblehop, thrash glitter and interfaith gospel. And I'm here to deliver a pizza."

He shrugged a pizza box from the top of the towering pile into her arms.

"Guhhhh..." Ashlin said again, taking it. She didn't even notice the searing grease soaking through the cardboard and dripping from her hands.

"Are you Ashlin? I must say, you're looking especially beautiful tonight," said Dustin Castor. Ashlin fainted.

--------

"Nice going," Lucile said, rolling her eyes. "You broke her. I told you to let me do it!"

Skye put down the microphone. "Do you even know how to work one of these things?"

"It's a perfectly simulated humanoid robot with four hundred points of articulation, not brain surgery," Lucile said. "I think I can handle it. Here, give me those controls and I'll get her up."

Skye handed over the control pad and Lucile bent over the drone control console, squinting at the image on the screen, which currently showed Ashlin sprawled on the floor under a pile of pizza. She pushed forward on the control stick, and the Castor-bot leaned down over the unconscious girl.

"Wake up!" Lucile said, and yanked the arm control stick to the right. The drone gave Ashlin a left hook across the face.

"Nice one," Skye observed.

"It was supposed to be a slap," Lucile shrugged, "but whatever works. It seems to have got her attention, anyway."

-----

Ashlin got unsteadily to her feet, dripping with grease and her own overflowing juices. "Ooh, Dustin, I can't believe it's really you," she swooned. "Somebody pinch me!"

Dustin reached forward awkwardly and gave her a double titty-twister that brought tears to her eyes.

"Ow-how-how, oh my, you don't waste any time, do you?" Ashlin said. "Well, I won't either. My parents are totally gone and they have a water bed."

Dustin frowned. "As much as I'd love to pump you full of my Castor oil, my dear sugar-butt, I have these pizzas to deliver first."

"Leave them here," Ashlin begged. "I'll pay for them all!"

"I don't know. I hate to think of them going to waste."

"I'll eat them!" Ashlin assured him.

"They're not that good once they're cold."

"I'll eat them all now!" Ashlin pleaded desperately. "Just stick around!"

"Wellletmethinkaboutithmmokay," Dustin said. "Go to it!"

He hustled Ashlin to the couch and plopped the towering pile of pizza boxed into her lap. She gulped. The pile came up to eye level. She opened the first box and lifted out a steaming slab of cheese and dough buried under spicy sausage and anchovies.

If it'll get me a night with Dustin Castor, she thought, my stomach can take anything! She stuffed the first slice in her mouth and chewed furiously, cheeks bulging and stringy mozzarella hanging her from her lips like Spanish moss.
141222.title: Authentic 1970s Deep-Dish Porn

choices: Ashlin starts to clean, up when she sees Dustin left her chocolates
Meanwhile, Lucile continues her EVIL planning! ...And Skye gets dragged along
1412221.content:
"Wow, she's actually going for it." Skye said with an impressed tone in her voice, lifting the grey mic up from her head.

"What kinda musician is this Castor guy anyway?" Lucile asked with her usual deadpan tone and expression. "He any good?"

"Depends: You were usually listening to stuff in class like The New York Dolls, The Beatles and...what was that other one...?"

"Maximum the Hormone?"

"I think. So you wouldn't like this guy." Skye stuck her tongue partway out her mouth.

-------

Ashlin took in a gasp of air, breathing out her nose and taking a large gulp from a glass of Coca-Cola on the table. The carbonated beverage helped her burp, cleared more room down in her stomach. Even though clearing twelve extra large loaded pizzas was much harder than she initially thought, just looking over at Dustin Castor, who stared at her stoically and silently with his nearly flawless face was enough to rekindle the vigor inside of her.

She was one pizza down, eleven more to go.

-------

"...Two weeks later, ma was in Tunisia killing a man." Skye finished.

"Damn." Lucile said in her usual tone, munching on some potato chips from a bag that came seemingly out of nowhere.

"...Hey Lucile." Skye asked, her tone becoming more serious.

"Yah?" Lucile's mouth as full of half-chewed chips.

"You have any idea why Ashlin's got such a vendetta against fat people? I never understood that about her.

-------

Ashlin groaned as she was about halfway down her third pizza. It tasted good, of course! ANYTHING given to her by Dustin Castor personally couldn't NOT be the Fillet Mignon of it's grouping! Her stomach felt taut and began to bloat outward a while into her second pizza, making it look a lot like Lucile's big cocoa filled belly when they met earlier. Maybe she should reconsider. She thought to herself, as her gaze turned to Castor...and then to his belt area.

Her waistline be damned!

------

"Based on what I learned in dabbling in psychology, Ashlin may be projecting."

Skye blinked. "Projecting? What is she jealous of fat people?"

"Maybe." Lucile said as she crumpled her now empty chip bag and tossed it aside carelessly. "I knew her before you did: She was always chubby in preschool up to...I wanna say second grade. Her parents...they were colder than dry ice. They wouldn't berate her, instead they'd just look and speak to her with this chilling, tranquil disappointment. Know why they're out and leaving their little girl by herself? Probably so they can fuck on a private Yacht off the coast of Wales or some shit."

Skye seemed surprised. Where, she didn't know where to begin. First was the fact Lucile seemed angry. It wouldn't be an understatement to say inside, she was even outright pissed by the notion of Ashlin's parents coming off as so neglectful. Second, for a moment it sounded like she pitied Ashlin. It seemed hypocritical with just what they were doing, but as far as Skye knew Lucile either thought putting Ashlin in a great enough stressful situation would help her somehow see not to let her parent's judgement control her life...or Lucile just didn't want to see Ashlin get off the hook without punishment for her usual stunts.

------

"Guhh..." Ashlin groaned sickly.

Six. Freaking. Pizzas. She was halfway and already, she felt like she hit a brick wall. Well, not so much hit as rammed into going from naught to 60. Lethargy reared it's head as Ashlin leaned back, her arms folded out along the back of her sofa. Her stomach stood out in front of her, swollen, taut and red, looking like a tight beachball.

"No more..." She groaned as she stifled a burp.

Castor walked over and gently placed a hand on Ashlin's cheek. He looked in her eyes, entrancing her and making her blush, then kissed her on her lips, which tasted of mozzarella and tomato sauce. Not that he would know as he was just a humanoid robot, but it was there. As if through sheer willpower, her stomach seemed to somehow compact the eaten pizza in her gut, kick her brain and metabolism in the ass AND give a middle finger right to the face of common sense as Ashlin suddenly began to plow through the seventh pie.

I don't care if I get fat. I don't care if my stomach explodes! Ashlin yelled in her head. Right now, all I care about is getting that Castor Oil inside me!
------

Lucile sat back, reading Game of Thrones, her back against a tree.

"...Hasn't it been some time since we checked on Ashlin?" Skye piped up.

"Uh? Oh yeah right." Lucile said, putting the book aside and placing a folded, small paper inside as a bookmark. She grabbed the control pad and leaned forward, looking down at the video display from Castor's eyes.

"Crap." Lucile said aloud. "I think we killed her."

"WAIT WHAT!?" Skye yelled. Lucile moved Castor forward, revealing Ashlin's comically overstuffed gut as she laid back limply on the couch. The drone moved forward and checked her pulse. Lucile hit a button and the screen switched over to a heart monitor.

"Nope, spoke too soon. She's alive." Lucile said calmly. "She just passed out from all the food."

Skye let out a sigh of relief, running her hands through her hair.

"Ohh, thank Christ..." She muttered to herself. Lucile, for some reason, shot Skye an annoyed look for a second.

"I think now's as good a time to move out. We'll retire the Drone for now and see what we come up with next."

"Crap there's more?"

"Oh yeah, LOT'S MORE." Lucile allowed a cheshire grin to form on her face, making Skye frown in discomfort seeing it.

--------

Ashlin awoke like a smackhead who had just gone on a bender the night before. She was dizzy, disoriented, felt like vomiting, hated herself for reasons she didn't rightly know and there were pizza boxes scattered all over the place. She felt a discomfort in her stomach, as she rubbed at it, hoping that-

Ashlin paused.

Her stomach felt soft. And squishy.

Lifting her T-shirt, Ashlin looked down at her stomach and gasped as she saw she now had a sizable, pudgy stomach. She reached back, feeling her "curvy" ass had gotten some extra cellulite added as well, giving it a soft and plush feeling to it. As she looked down at her belly, her breasts seemed slightly larger as well, likely also from the added fat. The one thing she wanted to see, Dustin Castor awaiting her with open arms (And possibly no pants) was gone. It felt like a dream, a very bad and disappointing dream. Unable to think of anything else to do, Ashlin threw her head in one of the couch pillows and SCREAMED.
1412221.title: How is a bratty teen like a bulldozer?

choices: That Monday, Lucile has a few choice words for her...
Skye has had enough, and gives her friend a taste of her own medicine...
14122211.content:
Ashlin threw the pillow to one side, shattering a lamp, and crossed her arms. "Stupid Dustin Castor and his stupid pizzas making me stupid fat! If that bitch Lucile sees me like this, she'll have a fucking field day! Maybe if I were my baggiest sweater on Monday... and my baggiest jeans... and my baggiest...urggh... bra..."

She stood up unsteadily, unbalanced like a late-game Jenga tower with fat and pizza slapped onto and in uncomfortable places, and stumbled to the bathroom. After a process outside the scope of this narrative (but quite necessary when one has eaten a stack of pizzas bigger than R2-D2), she returned, feeling a lot less bloated but still much fatter than she wanted to be.

"I'll just have to exercise! Really, really, hard. Yeah, that's it...first I'll get rid of the junk in the room, and then I'll get rid of the junk in my trunk, before that creepy shitbag Lucile gets a chance at it. That freaking fatty is just the kind of hypocrite who would make fun of other people's weights." Ashlin picked up pizza boxes and discarded crusts and cheese particles as she talked. Suddenly, she realized that one of the pizza boxes was not, in fact, a pizza box at all, but a pizza-box-sized heart made of pink satin and trimmed with lace, and tucked into the ribbon was a note, "From your Dustin-poo".

She ripped off the lid, revealing row upon row of chocolates nestled in formation like terra cotta soldiers, milk and dark, cream and caramel, dusted and topped and coconuted, knotted, polka-dotted, twisted, beaded, braided, powdered, flowered, and confettied, bangled, spangled, tangled, and spaghettied. A tiny card was laid right on top of them, and, in delicated script, was written the words: "Special chocolates that make you lose weight."

-------

Meanwhile, that creepy shitbag Lucile was having a fucking field day. "Oh man, watch this! She's totally going to eat them now!"

"And?" Skye asked.

"And? And she'll get even fatter!" Lucile giggled. "I'm going full Anna Nicole on this one! What's that your grandpa always used to say? 'No half-measures'?"

"Yeah..." Skye mused. "I wonder whatever happened to him? My sister said he just said he totally ditched her at the park one day..."

"Look, look, she's going for it!" Lucile shrieked happily, watching Ashlin pick up one of the chocolates. "She's going to eat it! Welcome to Fatville, Ashlin! Population: your ass!"

"Come on, Lucile," Skye sighed. "Not even Ashlin is THAT gullible."

------

Ashlin tossed the chocolate into her mouth and chewed thoughtfully. Hmm. Key lime and peanut butter. Interesting combination. But if that was what it took to make her thin...

She swallowed and looked down at her stomach. Still sticking out. She reached behind her and felt her butt. Still felt like two pillows in a pair of jeans. She cupped her boobs. Eh, that part was okay. But it was obvious that the chocolate hadn't fixed anything.

Still, she told herself, I didn't get any fatter just now, so at least I know they won't hurt.

And so she continued stuffing chocolate into her face as she cleaned up, hopeful that by Monday morning she would be back to her slender old self again.
14122211.title: Chocolates Reign!

choices: Lucile continues, pelting Ashlin with more insults
Lucile suddenly...spins this into a positive thing for Ashlin?! WHAT?
141222111.content:
Ashlin blushed as she walked down the hallways of the academic building in St. Hellenist's Collage, holding her books against her chest as she tried to stay out of sight, her plump hips swaying against her will.

I'm never listening to any of Castor's music again... Ashlin thought to herself.

The chocolates she'd eaten over the weekend had, along with her weight, blown up in her face. She was now meatier than she had been before. She felt bloated but less in the "Why did I eat so much freaking pizza" sort of way and more of the "I hate how fat I am" sort of way.

Her plump stomach was too large to hide under a sweater, not to mention much too big for any of her shirts to fit her anymore. The thigh-high socks she decided to wear to school today looked closer to knee-high thanks to her thick, fat legs. She had to buy a new skirt to wear, a black non-descript looking one like you'd see on a corporate secretary, because she outgrew all those too and the ones that did fit her showed off her stretched out panties. Her breasts, even under her sweater and with the bra she had bought the other day, managed to jiggle ever so slightly if she moved too much due to their size and the extra fat stored inside. She had gone up to a large DD, maybe even a small E for all she knew! That part she didn't mind, but it didn't really matter when you looked so...meaty. To keep people from recognizing her for as long as possible, she wore her reddish-brown curly hair down when she preferred to tie it back and she wore a new pair of large, black framed sunglasses with dark brown shades over her hazel eyes.

She could imagine Lucile would have a blast, but at least their schedules were so drastically different, she could only have seen her during lunch, at which point Ashlin planned to hide herself in her car, drive about five minutes away and hope to god Lucile didn't wind up catching up to her. There's no way she'd let Lucile have any pleasure in mocking her if she could help it. She imagined Lucile's thin, long, creepy smile and her high-pitched, manic, super-villain laughter.

"Well...at least it can't get worse" Ashlin said aloud to herself, taking a pause to hope she didn't jinx things. At least on the upside, she'd found an eraser by her desk during first period. She tended to lose things, but just as likely found new ones. She considered herself lucky like that and hoped that luck would be of some help in the days to come.

---------

Lucile scowled as she sat by her desk, listless as her history, Mr. Pius (who lived up to his name) teacher droned on. They'd already covered today's lecture on the Middle East so he was taking about the origins of Christianity around those parts, rambling about the origin of Lucifer and how he had become Satan (which, from his mouth, was MUCH less interesting than Lucile would have liked it to be). She wanted to get out there and grin and laugh at Ashlin after she'd eaten those chocolates. She felt proud that she'd not only had them made to suit Ashlin's tastes, but also dipped them in metabolic alteration drugs given to people who needed to achieve a healthier weight within a short timespan.

Lucile rapped her gloved fingers against the desk. She got some flak from certain individuals (especially Miss Tenenbaum, her Composition teacher) for dressing too much like a punk or "not feminine enough." In order to play around with both parties, she made it a habit to show up to school dressed in a fine suit. Today, she wore one of her favorites; a double-breasted black suit with red vertical striped on it with matching slacks accompanied by fine white gloves and brown boots with steel-toes for decoration. She had gotten in trouble for these boots before, claiming the metal plating was far too thin to result in any further damage and would only be a threat if she was actually considering hurting any students.

Her record had at least been clean in the violence department so far.

Lucile's body did have some new curves to it. Over the weekend, she decided to expand upon her original idea of gaining weight so she could better survive. After all, skinny and healthy were two different things. Her pudgy stomach appeared flat under her suit, but she had noticeable breasts. They were still small, but they were there and her behind, to her minor chagrin thanks to Ashlin's comment, had become a bit more round and full with more feminine looking hips. Lucile sighed dreamily as her mind drifted, watching clouds as she reminisced on the last time she did this. She saw a dog get emancipated in the grill of a huge truck. Everyone freaked out when she suddenly burst out laughed that day.

"Lucile...Lucile!" Mr. Pius called out.

"Huh?"

"What does Lucifer's name translate to from how it's written in the Old Testament?"

"...The Morning Star."

"Excellent, so you ARE listening. I suppose that makes up for you seeming to lose your erasers on a constant basis." Pius teased.

Lucile looked over as Mr. Pius took a sip of his coffee. It was then she got an idea.

"Mmm...augh, my coffee tastes a bit different. What, did the cream go bad?"

"In a way." Lucile grinned her trademark grin.

Everyone sitting in desks near hers moved away out of fear she would suddenly disembowel them all.

"What do you mean?"

"Ever hear the saying 'who pissed in your coffee?' sir~?"

There was a pause. Mr. Pius groaned.

"It's worse~ Someone outright jacked off in your morning Joe."

Mr. Pius ran out the door as he suddenly began to dry heave. The other students began to pipe up with raucous laughter and groans of disgust at the reveal as Lucile took this moment to saunter out of class.
-----------------
Ashlin looked around as she moved on. It was almost lunch and no sign of Lucile. She just needed to-

"S'uuup pig~?"

Ashlin froze in place, like her feet were trapped in stone. She wanted to run, just run for it and never look back! But, she felt held in place as the only movements she could make were to turn around and look as Lucile leaned against the wall, her head held low as the blond girl smiled scornfully.

"Hih hih hih~ Why do you look so scared? We're friends aren't we?"

Ashlin could only scoff as Lucile cut her off before she could deliver her witty retort.

"Aw no need to be cold around present company. After all, with that extra padding you should be plenty warm come winter."

Ashlin's face flushed red as she pouted with an embarrassed look on her face.

"Eeyahahahahah!! How's it feel to be the lard ass now huh?!" Lucile cackled, clutching her side and her face as she was positively beside herself in laughter. "Always throwin' around put downs like they were going out of style. Well how's it feel to be the lard ass now!? For your thighs to touch and your body to jiggle?!"

Lucile cackled again. Ashlin felt like she would cry from just how embarrassed she was.
141222111.title: Next year, this would be Fat Tuesday

choices: "Yeah, I think you're right."
"Meh, bitch had it comin' "
*She moves on to play Nightmare Fiction*
1413.content:
Even in her cocoa-addled state, Lucile couldn't help but smile scornfully. She started chuckling to herself before breaking out into her high, hyena like laughter, almost sounding a touch wheezy at the end.

"Hyahahahah!! Oh suddenly I'm the freak now? You actually consider yourself normal in the least bit?"

Skye seemed rather surprised. As far as she knew, Lucile had been more prone to take the passive response, maybe at times respond with some tranquil fury, but she had NEVER seen Lucile outright mock or attack someone in any way before. She was either very tired of Ashlin's shit or she had been pushed right off the deep end and she wasn't particularly comfortable looking at that snake-like grin on Lucile's face along with the ominous look in her eyes. Ashlin just crossed her arms over her chest and scoffed.

"Uhh what are you even talking about you mass social reject?"

Lucile's grin fell back to a faux polite smile as she looked up at Ashlin's face.

"Well look at the facts after all Ashy-dear. You maya been queen of shit mountain at school but what about aside from that? Up until a couple years back I had myself a kind, caring family that loved me, a well-adjusted home that featured a supporting environment and even then I STILL get support from distant relatives in the form of gifts and checks. True summa the gifts I just send back or pawn off but that's not the point. How could someone who's supposedly "normal" lecture me on being a normal person when all she does is bitch and moan about her life while her parents go off screwin' each other on private yachts or whatever. Not to mention screwin' you outta the love you think you deserve right."

Ashlin winced, her facial expression beginning to become unstable. It was painfully obvious that Lucile had hit a very sensitive nerve and Skye didn't know what would come of it. Lucile merely laughed scornfully, bringing one hand up to her face and the other to her right side, which was admittedly in stitches.

"Hya hah hah hah! That's right the old 'Mommy and Daddy never loved me' Schitck! 'Mother...father why don't you love me...? Why do you ignore me?' Aww how cruel of them."

The politeness in Lucile's voice was obvious, thinly veiled mockery. Ashlin balled her hands into fists. Given what she'd seen Ashlin do to Lucile in the past, Skye was honestly at a loss as to weather she should stop Lucile or just keep staying out of it. Not to mention part of her was afraid of incurring Lucile's wrath upon her as well and being, essentially, mocked to the point where she was left at such loss and humiliation the aftermath looked as if she had been assaulted.

"Maybe they have a reason why they don't love ya. Maybe they're too busy with their jobs and enjoying their own lives they just never gave a shit about you. Maybe they decided that you would be shit from the day you were born and basically threw you on the backburner for their list of priorities. All the guys you dated, all the 'friends' you had, they all didn't mean a damn thing. They just wanted to be friends with the rich girl who could make anything happen by bitchin' to mom and dad about it, who themselves couldn't care less if you'd died in a gas leak while they were gone!" Lucile broke into a hyena-like fit of laughter again, which seemed crueler and more scornful that the last two bouts.

Ashlin was in tears. Her face was red and her lips were trembling. Her eyes had quickly become red as she pitifully let a quiet whimper escape her lips. She only allowed herself to sob after she took off running, making sure she was as far from Lucile as she possibly could be before she make her pain fully plain to everyone. Skye stared in awe and even some terror at Lucile. All this time, she sat and took all the berating and bullying Ashlin put her through and when she finally had her chain pulled around enough, she sure bit back. She watched as Lucile, almost instantly, swapped from being a merciless, scornful psychological destroyer to the same oddball she usually was, poking her stuffed belly to make herself burp in quick succession to the tune of "Gluttony Fang" from BlazBlue.

"...Kinda not cool what you did there." Skye said after along silence on her end.

Lucile looked up at Skye with her usual dull blue eyes, the shading on her face from her black beanie accentuating the dark circles under her eyes.

What you need to know is it involves women gaining weight and using dark comedy is encouraged natch :P I'll allow slobby behavior as well as soft vore (Swallowing whole) futa, and minor slobbiness like burping and some farting.

The story focuses on a...strange young woman named Lucile who, one day, considers suicide out of boredom. Where she goes from there, you're all free to decide. Does she learn to enjoy life or become a batshit crazy (and awesome) assassin for example? You decide friends!
